intro: Phanera pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the wet season, attracting various pollinators. Phanera pauciflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
